briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Naldemedine in the Treatment of Opioid-induced Constipation
officialTitle: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel-group Study of Naldemedine in the Treatment of Opioid-induced Constipation in Subjects With Non-malignant Chronic Pain Receiving Opioid Therapy
summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of naldemedine in the treatment of opioid-induced constipation (OIC) in adults with non-malignant chronic pain who are not using laxatives.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Spontaneous Bowel Movement (SBM) Response
